greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The period of the sequence i^i (mod n) starts from i=a(n).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
R. Hampel, The length of the shortest period of rests of numbers n^n, Ann. Polon. Math. 1 (1955), 360-366.
formula: If n = Product_{pi^ei} then a(n) = Max_{1- pi*(1+floor[-ei/pi])}.
program: return 1 if n==1 else max(1 - i*(1 + (-f[i])//i) for i in f)
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 201)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 29 2017
results.author: _José María Grau Ribas_, Jan 21 2012
